vibration

Class QXTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • vibration.QXTransformer

  • public class QXTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides transformation between Cartesian and vibrational coordinates.
    Since:
    Sindo 3.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kiyoshi Yagi

    • Method Detail

      • q2x

        public double[][] q2x(double[] qq)
        Transform the geometry in q to x: xx = x0 + qq*CL
        Parameters:
        qq - Vibrational coordinates [Nfree] (bohr(emu)1/2)
        Returns:
        Cartesian coordinates [Nat][3] (bohr)

      • dq2dx

        public double[][] dq2dx(int qi,
                        double q)
        Returns the displacement in Cartesian: dx = q*CL[i]
        Parameters:
        qi - Mode to be displaced
        q - Vibrational coordinate of the qi-th mode (bohr(emu)1/2)
        Returns:
        Displacement [Nat][3] (bohr). This is a newly generated object.

      • gx2gq

        public double[] gx2gq(double[] gxyz)
        Converts the gradient in x to q.
        Parameters:
        gxyz - Gradient in Cartesian (Hartree/bohr).
        Returns:
        Gradient in vibrational coordinates [Nat*3] (Hartree/bohr(emu)^1/2)

      • hx2hq

        public double[][] hx2hq(double[] hxyz)
        Converts the Hessian in Cartesian to Vibrational coordinates
        Parameters:
        hxyz - Hessian in Cartesian in a packed form [Nat3][Nat3] (Hartree/bohr^2).
        Returns:
        Hessian in vibrational coordinates [Nfree][Nfree] (Hartree/bohr^2 (emu)

      • hx2hq

        public double[][] hx2hq(double[][] hxyz)
        Converts the Hessian in x to q.
        Parameters:
        hxyz - Hessian in Cartesian [Nat3][Nat3] (Hartree/bohr^2).
        Returns:
        Hessian in vibrational coordinates [Nfree][Nfree] (Hartree/bohr^2 (emu)
